title: The Beatles Studio Albums
description: The Beatles were an English rock band formed in Liverpool in 1960. With members John Lennon, Paul McCartney, George Harrison and Ringo Starr, they became widely regarded as the foremost and most influential music band.  This quest includes all of the core catalog, and is in order based on original album release date.

questEntries.title: Please Please Me
questEntries.description: Nationwide interest in the Beatles had been piqued with the success of their second UK single and Parlophone Records, hoping to take advantage of this, promptly decided to follow it up with an album.

questEntries.title: With the Beatles
questEntries.description: This was released on 22 November 1963, on Parlophone, and was recorded four months after the band's debut Please Please Me.

questEntries.title: A Hard Day's Night
questEntries.description: In contrast to their first two albums, all 13 tracks on A Hard Day's Night were written by John Lennon and Paul McCartney showcasing the development of their songwriting talents.

questEntries.title: Beatles for Sale
questEntries.description: The album marked a departure from the ebullient tone that had characterised the Beatles' previous work, partly due to the band's exhaustion after a series of tours that had established them as a worldwide phenomenon in 1964.

questEntries.title: Help!
questEntries.description: This was the fifth album release by the band, and contains fourteen songs in its original British form. Seven of these, including the singles 'Help!' and 'Ticket to Ride', appeared in the film and took up the first side of the vinyl album. The second side contained seven other releases including the most-covered song ever written, 'Yesterday'.

questEntries.title: Rubber Soul
questEntries.description: Rubber Soul met with a highly favourable critical response and topped record charts in Britain and the United States for several weeks.

questEntries.title: Revolver
questEntries.description: This was the Beatles' final recording project before their retirement as live performers and marked the group's most overt use of studio technology up to that time.

questEntries.title: Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band
questEntries.description: This album was lauded by the vast majority of critics for its innovations in music production, songwriting and graphic design, for bridging a cultural divide between popular music and high art, and for providing a musical representation of its generation and the contemporary counterculture.

questEntries.title: Magical Mystery Tour
questEntries.description: Despite widespread media criticism of the Magical Mystery Tour film, the soundtrack was a critical and commercial success and a number one Grammy-nominated album in the US.

questEntries.title: The Beatles ('The White Album')
questEntries.description: A double album, its plain white sleeve has no graphics or text other than the band's name embossed, which was intended as a direct contrast to the vivid cover artwork of the band's earlier Sgt. Pepper's Lonely Hearts Club Band.

questEntries.title: Yellow Submarine
questEntries.description: The album contains six songs by the Beatles, including four new songs and the previously released 'Yellow Submarine' and 'All You Need Is Love'. The remainder of the album is a re-recording of the film's orchestral soundtrack by the band's producer, George Martin.

questEntries.title: Abbey Road
questEntries.description: Abbey Road is a rock album that incorporates genres such as blues, pop, and progressive rock, and it makes prominent use of the Moog synthesizer and the Leslie speaker. Side two contains a medley of song fragments edited together to form a single piece.

questEntries.title: Let It Be
questEntries.description: Let It Be is the final studio album by the English rock band the Beatles. It was released almost a month after the group's break-up.
